solution.text:
Since Number of workers and number of days are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K \(= 1 \times 20\)
Now, 24 hours = 1 day
Therefore number of workers to complete job in one day \(= \frac K1 = \frac {20}{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of workers = 20

content.text: One worker can complete a job in 20 days. How many workers will it take to complete the same job in 24 hours?

hint.text: The number of workers and the number of days are inversely proportional.

solution.text:
Since Area is constant, Length and Breadth are inversely proportional. L \(\times\) B = A = K
Therefore, taking area constant, K = 60 \(\times\) 20 = 1200 cm\(^2\)
Hence, if Length = 40 cm
Breadth =\( \frac {1200}{40}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth = 30 cm

content.text: The length and breadth of a given rectangle are 60 and 20 cm. Given that the area remains constant find the breadth of the rectangle when length is 40 cm.

hint.text: Volume of cylinder = Pi x radius\(^2\) x height

solution.text:
Since Volume is constant, the square of radius of cylinder and height are inversely proportional.
Pi \(\times\) Radius\(^2\) \(\times\) Height = Volume = k. Therefore \( r^2 \times h \)= K [Pi is a constant]
Therefore, taking case 1, \(10^2 \times 200 \)= K
Hence, K= 20000
If Height= 50 cm
Radius\(^2 = \frac{K}{height}\)
Radius\(^2 = \frac{20000}{50}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius = 20 cm

content.text: The volume of a right angle solid cylinder is constant. If the height of the cylinder is 200 and Radius is 10 cm. Find the radius of the cylinder when the height is 50 cm.

solution.text:
Since distance between A and B is constant, speed and time are inversely proportional.
Speed \(\times\) time = Distance = K
But first we convert all time to minutes. Therefore,
1 hour = 60 min
Time taken by auto rickshaw = 420 min
Therefore now in case one, K = \( 420 \times 40\)
K = 16800
In the case of the car, speed = 160 km/h
Therefore time taken = \( \frac {K}{160} = \frac {16800}{160}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Time taken by car = 105 min

content.text: An auto rickshaw travels between two places A and B in 7 hours at the constant speed of 40 km/h. If a car travels at constant speed of 160 km/h, How many minutes will it take from A to B?

content.text: Fill the unknown quantity in the following tables considering X and Y are inversely proportional:

hint.text: Remember that any two quantities that can be represented as xy=k, where k is a proportionality constant are inversely proportional to each other.

solution.text:
Since the total number of workers = 80
Workers who leave the team = 40
Therefore, Workers left for the second time = 80- 40 = 40
Since the numbers of workers and number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional we get,
\( 64 \times 80\) = Constant
\(40 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time) = Constant
Therefore,\( 64 \times 80 = 40 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time)
Number of days to complete job second time =\( \frac {64 \times 80}{40} \)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of days to complete the job second time = 128

content.text: You are a contractor and are given a contract to pave a road. It takes you 80 trained workers and 64 days to finish the job. Unfortunately there is a problem and you must redo all the work again. 40 workers leave your team. How much time will it take the remaining to redo the work and complete the job for a second time?
Answer the question below:

hint.text: The total number of workers and the number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional

solution.text:
Since X and Y are inversely proportional XY = k
Therefore, \(\frac 1a \times 640= 10 \times a\)
Hence, \( a^2 = 64\)
\(\Rightarrow\) a = 8

b =\( \frac {80}{320}\)

From previous subpart, \(a = 8\)

solution.text:
Since the distance of the race is a constant = 1600 m
Therefore, we know the number of participants taking part and distance each participant runs are inversely proportional
Number of participants x distance each runs = total distance of race
16 \(\times\) Distance run by each participant = 1600
Distance run by each participant = \( \frac{1600}{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Distance run by each participant = 100 m

content.text: A 1600 metre relay race, has 4 participants in each team. Due to bad organisation, 4 times the participants come from each school and the rules are changed such that now each team has 16 participants. How much distance does each participant run?

The two quantities are inversely proportional.

solution.text:
Since X and Y are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K =\( 110 \times 10 = 1100\)
Hence, when x = \(550\)
y =\( \frac {1100}{550}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) y = 2
